meanings.definition: A protein subunit that makes up the capsid of a virus.
meanings.sent1: Capsomeres are like tiny building blocks in a virus.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study capsomeres to understand how viruses work.
meanings.sent3: The capsomeres in the virus were having a party inside the cell.
meanings.sent4: Under the microscope, capsomeres look like colorful puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The capsomeres assembled themselves into a protective shell around the virus.

meanings.definition: The building blocks of a viral capsid.
meanings.sent1: Tiny capsomeres come together to form the viral capsid.
meanings.sent2: Capsomeres play a crucial role in the structure of viruses.
meanings.sent3: The capsomeres decided to race each other to see who could build the capsid faster.
meanings.sent4: The capsomeres interlocked perfectly, creating a strong viral shield.
meanings.sent5: Each capsomere fits snugly with its neighbors, like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle.

meanings.definition: The structural units of a viral protein coat.
meanings.sent1: The viral protein coat is made up of many capsomeres.
meanings.sent2: Capsomeres link together to form the protective protein coat.
meanings.sent3: The capsomeres in the protein coat were chatting about their day.
meanings.sent4: Like bricks in a wall, capsomeres provide strength to the protein coat.
meanings.sent5: The capsomeres shimmered under the light, creating a beautiful coat for the virus.
